thread.title: UK football signee Lynn Bowden drops 41 points
thread.title_full: UK football signee Lynn Bowden drops 41 points

title: UK football signee Lynn Bowden drops 41 points
text:
UK football signee Lynn Bowden drops 41 points Kentucky football signee Lynn Bowden dropped 41 points in a high school basketball game Tuesday night. Slot to Kentucky Links 
Kentucky football signee Lynn Bowden continues to prove there isn't really a whole lot he can't do. 
Bowden, who in February became one of the highest-rated football signees in the Mark Stoops Era, scored 41 points in Youngstown (Ohio) Warren G. Harding's 100-88 overtime victory over Maple Heights Tuesday night. 
After missing what would have been the game-winner at the end of regulation, Bowden scored 10 of his team's 15 points in the extra period. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
"In overtime, I just put them on my back," Bowden told The Tribune Chronicle . 
Bowden (6-1, 185), who has scored over 1,000 points in his career, is ranked as the No. 2 athlete in the country and No. 110 overall prospect in the country by 247Sports . 
On the football field as a senior last season, Bowden accounted for over 3,600 total yards and 55 touchdowns, leading UK recruiting coordinator Vince Marrow to call him "the best player in Ohio." 
"I will go on the record as saying we signed the best player in Ohio, Marrow said on National Signing Day. "Lynn Bowden is the best player in Ohio. If you ask 30 reporters who cover Ohio football they all will say heâ€™s the best player in Ohio." 
Earlier this month, Bowden posted video of himself throwing down an impressive one-handed, off-the-wall, 180-degree dunk .
